title: 107_hr2310
content: The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for uniformed services members effective January 1, 2002, based on pay grade and years of service. The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for commissioned officers based on pay grade and years of service. The table shows percentage increases in monthly basic pay for commissioned officers based on pay grade and years of service. The table displays percentage increases in monthly basic pay for commissioned officers according to pay grade and years of service, ranging from over 18 to over 26. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service as an enlisted member or warrant officer are eligible for percentage increases in monthly basic pay according to pay grade and years of service. The increases range from 2 or less years to over 16 years of service. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service are eligible for percentage increases in monthly basic pay based on pay grade and years of service. The increases range from 7.3% to 8.3% for different pay grades and years of service. Warrant officers receive percentage increases in monthly basic pay based on pay grade and years of service. The increases range from 7.5% to 8.5% for different pay grades and years of service. Warrant officers receive percentage increases in monthly basic pay based on pay grade and years of service, ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% for different pay grades and years of service. Enlisted members receive percentage increases in monthly basic pay based on pay grade and years of service, ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% for different pay grades and years of service. Enlisted members receive percentage increases in monthly basic pay based on pay grade and years of service, ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% for different pay grades and years of service, with specific percentages listed for each pay grade and years of service increment. Enlisted members receive percentage increases in monthly basic pay based on pay grade and years of service, ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% for different pay grades and years of service increments. The adjustment to monthly basic pay rates for uniformed services members in fiscal year 2002 required by section 1009 of title 37, United States Code, will not be made.
